13.28.010: RULES GENERALLY:
The following rules and regulations concerning the municipal water system are
prescribed as set forth in this chapter. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.020: RULE 1; RELOCATION OF SERVICE PIPE:
Whenever it is necessary to change the location of the service pipe for any
premises, due to a relocation of the city's mains, or in order to effect
economy, the city will install such service pipe in like size, furnish all
material and perform all work at its own expense, inside the property line of
the premises served, necessary to connect with the service in the new location,
whenever the conditions in such instances make any other arrangement unjust and
inequitable. Nothing in this rule shall be construed, however, as to estoppel
to the changing or relocating of the city's mains as the city elects. (Prior
code §27-6)
13.28.030: RULE 2; UNAUTHORIZED INTERFERENCE WITH CITY PROPERTY:
No mechanic, plumber, person or persons, not authorized agents of the city,
shall in any way tamper with, interfere with, or make repairs, connections or
replacements to any of the city's property. If a change or relocation of the
city's property is desired, the city must be notified of such a change, and if
the request for change is granted or approved, the change or relocation will be
made by the city's authorized agent at such time as is most convenient for the
city. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.040: RULE 3; UNAUTHORIZED TURN ON OR TURNOFF OF WATER:
No mechanic, plumber, person or persons, other than employees of the city,
shall be permitted or authorized to turn on or off the water the city has shut
off under any circumstances, for any premises, without permission of the city;
provided, however, that turnoffs may be made by persons other than city
employees in case service pipe or plumbing has burst and damage is resulting to
other property either of the city or the consumer. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.050: RULE 4; OWNER HAS RESPONSIBILITY FOR WATER SERVICE CHARGES:
Owners of real property being provided domestic water service by the city shall
be responsible for all deposits, fees and charges for such services,
irrespective of whether the owner is the occupant of the real property or is
otherwise a consumer as referenced in this chapter. All applications for
domestic water service must be made by the owner of the real property to be
provided the services. Monthly bills shall be sent to the owner who has made
the application for domestic water service. If the account has become
delinquent, the owner of the real property to which the services have been
provided shall be mailed a notice of termination of services at least ten (10)
days prior to actual termination, which notice must also set forth the amount
of all delinquent charges and fees. All fees and charges not paid by the date
of termination shall be the responsibility of the owner of the real property.
(Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.060: RULE 5; RESERVATION OF RIGHT TO SHUT OFF WATER SERVICE:
A.   The city reserves the right at any time to shut off the water supply for
repairs, extensions, nonpayment of bills and other reasons. Notice of such
shutoff, in case of repairs and extensions, will be given when convenient and
if time permits. Not less than twenty four (24) hours' notice will be given
when shutoff is to be made for nonpayment of bills or violations of rules of
the city.
B.   The city shall use reasonable diligence to provide sufficient and
continuous service, and, having used reasonable diligence, shall not be liable
to the consumer for failure or interruption of such service, but shall remove
the cause thereof with all reasonable diligence. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.070: RULE 6; PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE REQUIREMENT:
A.   All persons having boilers, water tanks or other equipment supplied by
direct pressure from the city's mains, shall install a pressure relief valve,
or other device to serve the same purpose, so as to prevent excess pressure
forcing hot water and steam back into the water meter or mains of the city.
B.   The consumer failing to equip and install properly the necessary pressure
relief valve, or other device on the premises connected with the city water
meter and mains in such a way as to avoid steam or hot water being forced back
into such meter and mains belonging to the city, will be responsible for the
damage resulting therefrom and the city will bill the consumer for such damage.
If such damage results on two (2) or more occasions to the city's property on
or at the same premises, the city may discontinue all service until the
necessary correction is made so as to prevent a recurrence. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.080: RULE 7; PRIVATE INSTALLATION OF PLUMBING:
The consumer must install and maintain at his own expense all pipes and other
plumbing within the boundary line of his premises. Installation of plumbing,
pipe fittings or repairs to plumbing on private property is not a part of the
city's business or service. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.090: RULE 8; CITY NOT LIABLE FOR DAMAGE DUE TO FREEZE UP:
The city shall not be responsible for damage resulting from freeze ups on any
part of the water pipes or other equipment inside the property lines of the
premises. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.100: RULE 9; CITY NOT OBLIGATED TO ASSIST IN THAWING PIPES:
The city is not obligated to perform any service in thawing of pipes, locating
leaks or other trouble inside the property line of any of its consumers. It
shall however, endeavor to assist the consumer in finding the cause of trouble
upon his premises whenever conditions will permit. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.110: RULE 10; PUBLIC WORKS DIRECTOR RIGHT OF ACCESS:
The public works director and employees duly designated by him, shall have
reasonable access to all real property supplied with water by the city's
delivery system for the purposes of installing water meters and reading the
same, and shall further inspect city property installed on said real property
which comprises part of the delivery or meter system, as required in this
chapter. (Ord. 627(SSS), 1980: prior code §27-6)
13.28.120: RULE 11; MAINTENANCE OF CITY FIXTURES:
Mains and pipes, apparatus, instruments, meters and materials supplied by the
city, shall remain its property, and shall be returned to it by the consumer in
the same condition as when received by the consumer, except for ordinary wear
and depreciation, and the city may at any time examine, change or repair its
property on the premises of the consumer, and may remove all such property at
the termination of service, or at any time thereafter. All damages or injury to
pipes, apparatus or materials of the city on the consumer's premises, caused by
an act or neglect of the consumer, shall be made good by the consumer. (Prior
code §27-6)
13.28.130: RULE 12; GROUND WIRE ATTACHMENT TO PLUMBING PROHIBITED:
All persons are strictly forbidden to attach any ground wire or wires to any
plumbing which is or may be connected to any service connection or main
belonging to the city. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.140: RULE 13; CITY AND CONSUMER LIABILITY LIMITATIONS:
Neither the city nor the consumer shall be liable to the other for any act or
omission caused directly or indirectly by strikes, labor troubles, accident,
litigation, United States, state or municipal interference, or other causes not
due to negligence, but the cause producing such an act or omission shall be
removed with all reasonable diligence. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.150: RULE 14; WRITTEN NOTICE REQUIREMENTS:
A.   Whenever by any rule, written notice is required to be given, such notice
shall be deemed to be completed:
   1.   If given to the city, when delivered to the city clerk's office in the
city, to any person regularly employed in such office; if deposited in the post
office, postage prepaid, and registered, addressed to the city at such office;
   2.   If given to the consumer personally, or by delivery to some person
regularly employed in or residing at the place where service is rendered; or
deposited in the post office, postage prepaid, and registered, addressed to the
consumer at such place.
B.   If notice is served by mail, the usual time for transmission of the mail
between point of deposit and the place of delivery, but in no case to exceed
three (3) days, shall be added to the time within which notice, as prescribed
by the rules, is to become effective. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.160: RULE 15; REPRESENTATIONS NOT BINDING UNLESS IN WRITING:
No promises, representations or advice of any employee of the city shall be
binding unless made in writing over the signature of the mayor and city clerk.
(Prior code §27-6)
13.28.170: RULE 16; WATER SERVICE RESALE PROHIBITED:
In no case will water service be furnished for resale purposes where the city
itself furnishes retail service of the same class or classes. (Prior code §27-
6)
13.28.180: RULE 17; EXTENSION WITHIN CORPORATE LIMITS:
A.   Extension, as contemplated in these rules, is as follows:
   1.   A branch from or continuation of an existing main or service pipe, or
both, to serve new business;
   2.   The changing of any main or service now installed to meet the
consumer's requirements;
   3.   Any increase of capacity of any existing extension. It may consist of
mains, service pipes, meters, connections and other materials; provided,
however, that extensions within the meaning of this rule shall not include
connection lines, pipes, taps and service lines on private property, which are
required to be installed and maintained at the consumer's expense pursuant to
rule 7 and all rules supplemental thereto.
B.   Whenever an applicant for service is not on an existing main, or a
consumer's operations are not located upon a completed main of such capacity as
to enable the city to furnish the service desired by the consumer, extensions
from the nearest available main to the applicant's or consumer's place of
operation will be made upon the following conditions:
   1.   The city shall not construct nor pay for the construction of water
distribution lines or laterals or other extensions which are not shown and
described in the maps, plans and specifications concerning the system now on
file in the office of the city clerk;
   2.   Any such lines or laterals or other extensions when needed shall be
constructed by the applicants for water service through or from the system, and
at their expense, including, but not limited to, a reasonable charge by the
city for city engineering, supervision and inspection, in accordance with the
specifications prescribed by the city engineer;
   3.   Any such lines or laterals or other extensions upon their connection to
the system shall become a part of the municipal water system owned, operated
and maintained by the city; provided, however, that except in the case of
subdivisions which are subject to the city's subdivision ordinance, copies of
which are on file in the office of the city clerk, extensions may be made at
city expense, either in whole or in part, in those cases where in the judgment
of the city exercised prior to commencement of construction thereof, such
extension will be in the best interests of the city.
13.28.190: RULE 18; ABANDONMENT OF SERVICE:
When the owner, at any time after the first year of service, entirely suspends
operations, with the intention to permanently abandon them, he may procure
cancellation of the contract upon written application to the city, made not
less than sixty (60) days before the effective date of such proposed
cancellation. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.200: RULE 19; ENLARGEMENT OF TAP AND SERVICE PIPE:
Where the owner desires the enlargement of his tap and service pipe because of
inadequacy and was not restricted in size by the city at the time of
installation, such enlargement will be made only at the owner's cost and
expense. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.210: RULE 20; FIRE HYDRANT SERVICE EXTENSION; GENERALLY:
Extensions and installations for fire hydrant service shall be as provided for
and set out under schedule 5, on file in the office of the city clerk. (Prior
code §27-6)
13.28.220: RULE 21; PRIVATE HYDRANT SERVICE EXTENSION:
A.   All installations or extensions for private fire hydrants or service as
provided for under schedule 2, on file in the office of the city clerk, shall
be as follows: All expenses for installation shall be paid for in cash by the
applicant before installation is made. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.230: RULE 22; EXTRATERRITORIAL SERVICE EXTENSION:
In all territory located outside of the corporate limits of the city, where the
city has a sufficient source of water and sufficient capacity in its mains
running parallel with the property for which service is desired, the city may
permit a connection thereto in the manner herein prescribed for property within
its corporate boundaries. An owner will be required to effect a satisfactory
conveyance of the fee title or an appropriate right of way as easement to any
not owned by the owner on which any connection is situated free of all liens
and encumbrances. All connections to and users of the water system outside the
corporate boundaries of the city are subject to the prior right of the city and
its inhabitants to the complete and full use of the system to the exclusion of
all present or future connectors or users. Water shall be used outside the
corporate limits only when it is above that necessary for the city's present
needs, and determination of the needs and requirements of the city and its
inhabitants with respect to water from its system is a fact to be determined by
the city council in its own sound discretion to be exercised from time to time
as occasion may require. While it is the purpose of the city to maintain a
water supply adequate to meet the needs of both the city and owners outside its
corporate limits and within the metropolitan area, there are many elements
which make it uncertain whether the supply can always be adequate for all, and
therefore in times of shortage, water service outside the city will be
curtailed on an equitable basis to be determined by the city council. (Ord.
1093, 2012)
13.28.240: RULE 23; FIRE HYDRANT CHARGES:
Charges for fire hydrants which are at this time installed, and future
installations shall be as provided for under schedule 5, on file in the office
of the city clerk. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.250: RULE 24; GATE VALVE INSTALLATION ON FIRE HYDRANTS:
Gate valves will be installed by the city upon all fire hydrants, standpipes
and other similar structures, whether public or private, so as to permit them
to be turned off without disconnecting service on any main. It is not intended
by this rule to require gate valves to be installed immediately on all
hydrants, standpipes and other similar structures now existing, but that the
valves shall be installed from time to time as the equipment referred to is
replaced or new installations are made. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.260: RULE 25; UNAUTHORIZED OPENING OF HYDRANTS:
No person, acting either for himself or as the agent of any person, persons,
firm, corporation or municipality, not authorized by the city, shall take any
water from any hydrant. Members of the fire department shall have authority to
open hydrants only for purposes in connection with firefighting or fire
protection operation. In the event water is desired from a fire hydrant, for
other than firefighting or fire protection operations, permission must be
obtained from the city to draw water from such fire hydrant. Such consent shall
not be given by the city until satisfactory arrangements have been made
concerning the condition and limitations for the service and the payment
thereof as provided for in schedule 4, on file in the office of the city clerk.
(Prior code §27-6)
13.28.270: RULE 26; PRIVATE FIRE HYDRANTS GENERALLY:
The use of water through an unmetered private fire service or tap, except for
testing purposes, is not allowed. The city may, at its option, seal the valves
on such fire lines, which seals may be broken only in case of fire. In the
event a test of the fire line is desired, the city must be notified and the
seals broken only in the presence of the city's agent. Any violation of this
regulation shall be sufficient cause for the city to discontinue the service.
Such service will not again be granted until satisfactory arrangements have
been made with the city concerning payment for water drawn from such fire
hydrant or service in the past and up until the time of disconnection, and then
only on a metered basis at the rate applicable. Nothing in this rule is to be
construed as an estoppel to the city metering the private fire service whenever
it desires, but the metered rate shall not apply in such case unless improper
use of water from such private fire service is disclosed by the meter. The city
may, with consent of the property owner, connect to the private fire service
for any premises, lines supplying domestic service for the same premises or
building. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.280: RULE 27; HAULERS AND CARRIERS:
No tap or service upon any premises shall be used by any other person, persons,
firm or corporation except those occupying or in charge of the premises to
which such tap or service is extended, unless provision is made for haulers and
carriers at the time of the signing of the regular application for service.
(Prior code §27-6)
13.28.290: RULE 28; FEE FOR CONSUMER SUPPLYING PREMISES OF ANOTHER:
Whenever any consumer (tap or service), coming within schedule 1, on file in
the office of the city clerk, shall permit any other person or persons, firm or
corporation, to take water from such consumer's premises without written
consent of the city, a charge of one dollar ($1.00) per month shall be made
against such consumer for each additional premises receiving, by carrier or
otherwise, water from such consumer's premises. Such charge is to be made
monthly in accordance with schedule 1, and the consumer, refusing to pay such
additional charge, shall be deemed a delinquent consumer, and dealt with
according to the rules of the city. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.300: RULE 29; COMMUNITY HYDRANT:
The city at all times shall maintain at least one hydrant or standpipe, more or
less centrally located, in the city, where water can be had in cans, barrels or
tank lots during regular business hours, as provided for in schedule 6, on file
in the office of the city clerk. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.310: RULE 30; METERS; GENERALLY:
Meters will be installed between the curbing and the sidewalk, or in the
sidewalk in front of the premises to be served, whenever possible. The city
reserves the right to install the meter at any other location it may deem
advisable. Whenever a meter is installed in the basement of the premises of a
consumer, or upon any other part of the consumer's premises, the city shall
secure the consent of such consumer for such installation, and when such
installation has been properly made the city shall not be held liable for any
damage resulting directly or indirectly from such installation unless
negligence is shown. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.320: RULE 31; METER; INSTALLATION:
In any building where the meter is to be installed in the basement, the
incoming water pipe must be so installed that it enters the basement at least
sixteen inches (16") from the riser in order that a meter can be set in a
horizontal position. All pipes to the different parts of the buildings or
grounds must take off from the consumer's service pipe at least one foot (1')
from the installed meter. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.330: RULE 32; METER; READING:
All water delivered by the city shall, except as specifically provided for in
schedules 2 and 5, on file in the office of the city clerk, be paid for
according to the measurement by meter or other measurements. For the purpose of
determining the amount of water delivered, the reading of each meter installed
shall be deemed conclusive as to the amount of water delivered through it,
unless upon being tested, such meter shall be found to register inaccurately,
in which event the provisions of these rules and regulations applicable
thereto, and as hereinafter provided, shall govern. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.340: RULE 33; METER; RATE PRIOR TO INSTALLATION:
Any service which is now installed, or which may hereafter be installed,
without a meter, is to be charged for on the minimum rate for such service as
may be described in any of the city's schedules until such time as a meter is
regularly installed. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.350: RULE 34; METER; TESTING:
A.   The city reserves the right to test any meter, at any time when it deems
it necessary, at its own expense.
B.   Whenever a meter, at the request of a consumer or at the option of the
city, has been tested within the eighteen (18) month period immediately
preceding a consumer's request for the testing of the meter, the consumer shall
be required to deposit the sum of one dollar ($1.00) with the city, and the
city's meter will be tested at the consumer's premises. The consumer will be
notified in advance and may be present or represented at such test. If upon
examination and the test, the meter is found to overregister more than three
percent (3%), another meter will be substituted therefor. The fee of one dollar
($1.00) so deposited in such cases will be repaid to the depositor and the
water bills adjusted to correct the error discovered, but in no case shall
adjustment of such error be made for a greater period than three (3) months. If
the meter shall be found to register less than three percent (3%) in excess of
the actual flow, or to register less than the actual quantity of water passing
through it, the fee of one dollar ($1.00) so deposited by the consumer will be
retained by the city, as compensation for the time required in making such
test. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.360: RULE 35; METER; RATE ESTIMATE IN EVENT OF FAILURE:
Should a meter fail to register, the water used will be estimated at:
A.   That of the same month of the previous year; or
B.   The average of the several preceding months on record. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.370: RULE 36; METER; MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Where a meter is installed upon the premises of a consumer, such consumer
shall, at all times, make it possible for the city or its representative to
read, test or repair such meter. Such consumer shall be liable to the city for
damages resulting to said meter, where such damage is directly caused by the
consumer, the immediate members of his family, his agents or employees. Where a
meter is installed in the sidewalk or curbing, the consumer will use every
effort to protect such meter from wilful or malicious destruction, together
with all other exposed property which may belong to the city, and which has
been used for the installation of such consumer's service. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.380: RULE 37; TURNON REQUIREMENTS:
A.   The city is not obligated to turn the water on for any person at any
premises until an "application for service" has been signed at the office of
the city, and schedule of service selected by the responsible party or his
agent, and the rules of the city providing for the payment of future water
bills, as set out by the rules hereinafter provided for, have been complied
with.
B.   No rate contract or application is assignable from one user to another,
except upon a written agreement of all parties concerned. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.390: RULE 38; CITY NONCOMPLIANCE TO TELEPHONIC REQUESTS:
The risk of noncompliance by the city to telephonic requests to have water
turned off or on at any premises, or for other purposes, is entirely assumed by
the person ordering. The failure of the city to perform work when so requested
will in no case be a reason for adjustment. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.400: RULE 39; CASH DEPOSIT; REQUIRED:
Upon signing the application for service, all owners of every kind and
description, excepting federal, state, county, municipal, religious and
charitable institutions, shall make a cash deposit securing the credit and the
payment for the service rendered by the city. The owners above exempt from
making said cash deposit shall be considered to have already established their
credit, but such owners are not exempted from the requirements of the other
rules of the city pertaining to an owner's credit, its establishment and
continuation. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.410: RULE 40; CASH DEPOSIT; RATES:
The city shall require deposit from all owners, except those referred to in
section
13.28.400, "Rule 39; Cash Deposit; Required", of this chapter, to secure the
payment of all bills as they mature. Such required deposit for owners shall be
a sum as fixed from time to time by resolution of the council. Deposits shall
not exceed the amount of an estimated ninety (90) days' bill of the owner. Upon
a user ceasing to be serviced by the system, any balance remaining of the
deposit shall be returned to the user upon proof of payment of all charges and
fees through the date of final use. The deposit shall also be returned to the
user upon timely payment in full of all user charges for a twelve (12)
consecutive month period. In the event the water service to an account is shut
off for reason of nonpayment and the deposit has already been returned, a new
deposit shall be required at the time services are restored. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.420: RULE 41; CASH DEPOSIT; APPLICATION TO AMOUNTS DUE:
The city shall have the right to apply such deposit to the payment of all
amounts due and owing from the owner, and if the owner shall fail to restore
any such deposit, upon ten (10) days' notice in writing, delivered personally
or by mail, the time of notice to be computed from the date of personal
delivery or date of mailing, the city, without further notice, may discontinue
service until the deposit is restored. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.430: RULE 42; BILLS; BILLING INTERVALS:
Bills are due on the date of bill, which, normally, will be rendered as nearly
as practicable at monthly intervals for all water service furnished during the
preceding month, as herein defined; but the city, at its option, may render
bills to regular owners at other, but in the case of residence owners, not
shorter, intervals; provided, that any owner may be billed at termination of
service. Temporary owners of any class may be billed at any time at the option
of the city. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.440: RULE 43; BILLS; NET RATES:
Net rates, if provided for in the schedule, are allowed on monthly bills only
when bill is paid in full at the city's office within ten (10) days after date
of bill, and on bills rendered at more frequent intervals, when paid within
three (3) days after date of bill, unless otherwise provided in the schedule
under which service is rendered, and when no previous bill for service remains
unpaid, unless disputed under section
13.28.450, "Rule 44; Bills; Disputed Amounts", of this chapter. Failure to
receive bill will not excuse failure to pay so as to entitle the consumer to
the net rate. When the last day of the application of net rate falls on a legal
holiday, the net rate will be allowed on the next business day. When
remittances are made by mail, the bills shall be deemed paid on the date of
mailing as shown by the postmark. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.450: RULE 44; BILLS; DISPUTED AMOUNTS:
A dispute as to the amount of a bill, or the credits to be allowed against the
same, shall not justify the owner in refusing to pay the bill when due, but if
the owner shall give written notice at the city's office, at the time of
payment (which must be before the delinquent date) that the bill is disputed,
stating the amount and reasons of the dispute, the city will forthwith
investigate such complaint and if such investigation shall disclose that the
owner's objections are well founded, the city will refund the amount of the
overpayment, or credit it upon the next monthly bill of the owner. (Ord. 1093,
2012)
13.28.460: RULE 45; BILLS; DELINQUENT:
(Rep. by Ord. 1077, 2010)
13.28.470: RULE 46; BILLS; VIOLATION OF REGULATIONS DEEMED DELINQUENCY:
If a violation has resulted in the user or owner securing water without paying
for it, as provided for in these schedules, rates, rules and regulations, the
city shall estimate the amount of water so used and the service of such owner
shall be considered delinquent, and is not to be reconnected or continued until
after this estimated bill has been adjusted. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.480: RULE 47; BILLS; DISCONTINUANCE OF ACCOUNT:
Accounts will be continued and water bills rendered regularly until the city
has been duly notified in writing, or in person, at the office of the city
clerk, during office hours, to discontinue service. Failure of the city to
close any account or discontinue service when such order is not given as above,
shall not be grounds for adjustment of charges rendered in accordance herewith.
(Prior code §27-6)
13.28.490: RULE 48; BILLS; METER READING DATES:
Meter readings are assumed to be made as of the twentieth day of the month, or
date nearest thereto, which is possible for the reading to be made. (Prior code
§27-6)
13.28.500: RULE 49; BILLS; EXCESS WATER CHARGE ADJUSTMENT:
Where there has been a substantial registration of water as shown by the meter
reading over the normal average of the owner affected, and such excess has been
caused by defect or defects on the premises occupied by such owner, and which
are repaired immediately upon discovery, the city will make settlement of the
charge of the excess water over the normal average as is fair and just under
all the facts and circumstances as shall be found to exist. No adjustment
whatever will be made unless due diligence is used on the part of the owner in
taking care of plumbing and repairing defects immediately upon discovery or
advice by the city that leaks are apparent. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.510: RULE 50; BILLS; CREDIT FOR INTERRUPTION OF SERVICE:
For any failure or interruption of service, such interruption being continuous
for twelve (12) hours or longer due to causes not the fault of the owner, the
city will credit the owner with the proportions of the service charge which
would otherwise accrue to the city during the period of failure or
interruption, but such credit will be made only when claim therefor is made in
writing at the city's office within forty eight (48) hours after any such
interruptions occur. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.520: RULE 51; BILLS; EXCEPTIONS TO MINIMUM CHARGES:
Excepting application providing for term minimum guarantee, based on special
investment made to serve consumer has been made, no water bill shall be less
than the minimum charge for a full month for service applied for under the
following conditions:
A.   Where the water is turned off within thirty (30) days after being turned
on;
B.   Where the water is turned on for the same consumer in the same premises
within twenty (20) days after being turned off. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.530: RULE 52; BILLS; SERVICE RESTORATION CHARGES:
Where service is terminated for nonpayment of delinquent bills, the city, as a
condition of restoring the service, shall charge the responsible party as
provided in other provisions of this title, the delinquent amount past due as
of the fifteenth of the same month of service termination. No employee or
officer of the city shall have the right to waive the charge provided for in
this rule. (Ord. 1142, 2015)
13.28.540: RULE 53; TAP OR SERVICE PIPE SIZE FIXING:
The city reserves the right to fix the size of the service pipe or tap and
meter to be installed at any premises. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.550: RULE 54; SERVICE PIPE EXTENSION:
Where it is necessary to extend the service pipe at the time of installation
through any basement or foundation wall, the applicant, at no expense to the
city, must provide and make the opening through such wall to accommodate the
introduction of the water pipe. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.560: RULE 55; STOP AND WASTE VALVE INSTALLATION:
A.   Stop and waste valves must be installed at the owner's expense, on all
taps in a place always accessible and so located so as to permit shutting off
the water for the entire premises with the least possible delay, and all
persons on the premises should become familiar with its location and use. Such
stop and waste valves shall be in addition to any which may be installed by the
city.
B.   It is not intended by this rule to require stop and waste valves to be
installed immediately upon all services heretofore installed, but that said
stop and waste valves shall be installed from time to time as services are
installed, repaired or replaced. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.570: RULE 56; APPLICANT RESPONSIBILITY FOR VIOLATION:
The person making the application for service is held responsible for any
violation of any of the rules hereinbefore set forth, even though the breach is
continued by someone employed either directly or indirectly by such person or
caused or continued by an immediate member of the family occupying the premises
covered by the application for service. (Prior code §27-6)
13.28.580: RULE 57; SERVICE APPLICATION TO CONSTITUTE CONTRACT:
All applications for service, when accepted by the city, together with the
schedules, rates, rules and regulations and all amendments thereof or
supplemental thereto, shall constitute the entire contract between the city and
owner unless provided for by separate agreement; such agreement to be approved
as to contents and form by the city council. (Ord. 1093, 2012)
13.28.590: RULE 58; TURN OFF FOR VIOLATION:
For any violation of the preceding rules and regulations by any individual, the
water service to said individual will be turned off as provided for, and will
not be reconnected until adequate assurances have been given the city that the
violations will cease and that the conditions in section
13.28.530, "Rule 52; Bills; Service Restoration Charges", of this chapter under
credit and billings have been complied with. A one hundred dollar ($100.00)
reconnect fee shall be assessed any individual found to have been a repeat
violator of the unauthorized water turn on provisions of this code. Penalties
provided for herein shall be in addition to whatever other penalties may be
provided for a violation of an individual portion of this chapter. (Ord. 710
§1, 1989: prior code §27-6)
13.28.600: PENALTY:
Any person found guilty of a violation of section
13.28.030 or section
13.28.040 of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor, punishable
by fine not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300.00) or incarceration in jail
for a period of time not to exceed six (6) months, or both. (Ord. 710 §2, 1989)
CHAPTER 13.29
BACKFLOW PREVENTION
SECTION:
13.29.010: Definitions
13.29.020: Cross Connections Prohibited
13.29.030: Discontinuance Of Water Service
13.29.040: Water Supply Protection
13.29.050: Duty To Install And Inspect Annually
13.29.060: New Construction
13.29.070: Existing Equipment
13.29.080: Repair And Maintenance Of Equipment
13.29.090: Access For Inspection
13.29.100: Certified Backflow Technician
13.29.110: Notification Of Public
13.29.120: Records
13.29.130: Violations
13.29.010: DEFINITIONS:
   BACK PRESSURE: A pressure, higher than the supply pressure, caused by a
pump, elevated tank, boiler, or any other means that may cause backflow.
   BACK SIPHONAGE: The flowing back of used water or other liquids, mixtures or
substances into the distribution pipes of a public drinking water supply system
from any source other than the intended source, caused by the reduction of
pressure in the public drinking water supply system.
   BACKFLOW: The reversal of the normal flow of water in a public drinking
water distribution system as a result of cross connection.
   BACKFLOW PREVENTION DEVICE: A device, assembly or means designed to prevent
backflow, designed to meet the standards for such desires as required by the
uniform plumbing code or similar nationally recognized code as adopted by the
city of Jerome.
   CROSS CONNECTION: Any actual or potential connection or structural
arrangement between a public or consumer's potable water system and any other
source or system through which it is possible to introduce into any part of the
potable system used water, industrial fluid, gas, or substance other than the
intended potable water with which the system is supplied, including, but not
limited to, any bypass arrangement, jumper connection, removable section,
swivel, changeover device, or any other temporary or permanent device because
of which backflow occurs.
   DIRECTOR: The public works director of the city. (Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.020: CROSS CONNECTIONS PROHIBITED:
The installation or maintenance of a cross connection within the area provided
potable water by the city is hereby prohibited. Any such cross connection now
existing is declared a nuisance and shall be removed or abated upon order of
the director. Failure to remove a cross connection or to install a backflow
prevention device approved by the Idaho department of health and welfare, as
the director may order, within ten (10) days of the order, shall result in the
discontinuation of potable water service until compliance with this chapter is
made. (Ord. 634 §2, 1980)
13.29.030: DISCONTINUANCE OF WATER SERVICE:
Where a cross connection exists, future extension of potable water service
through the city water system shall be contingent upon the removal of the cross
connection, or the maintenance of an adequate backflow prevention device, in
accordance with the order of the director. (Ord. 634 §3, 1980)
13.29.040: WATER SUPPLY PROTECTION:
No potable water service connection to any premises shall be installed or
maintained by the city, unless the water supplying the premises is protected as
required by this chapter. It shall be the responsibility of the owner of
occupiable premises to effect installation and inspections as required herein,
and to immediately give notice to the director. (Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.050: DUTY TO INSTALL AND INSPECT ANNUALLY:
It shall be the responsibility of the owner of a property where drinking water
is consumed to purchase, install, test and maintain backflow prevention devices
or assemblies commensurate with the degree of hazard wherever it will be
possible for a cross connection to exist. Each owner shall have a certified
inspection and operational test made at least once a year at the owner's
expense. Where the city deems the hazard to be especially significant, the city
may require the owner to have such inspections and tests at a more frequent
interval. All such tests shall be made according to the standards set forth by
the state of Idaho department of environmental quality. Test reports will be
made in triplicate, with copies going to the owner, the director and to the
inspector. (Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.060: NEW CONSTRUCTION:
The director will review all plans and inspect new construction to ensure that
unprotected cross connections are not an integral part of the owner's water
system. If a cross connection cannot be eliminated, protection will be
required. Installation of an air gap or other approved backflow prevention
device in accordance with the uniform plumbing code or other similar nationally
recognized code as then adopted by the city shall be required. The owner shall
provide the director with verification of a certified test of the backflow
prevention device before a certificate of occupancy is issued. (Ord. 1025,
2007)
13.29.070: EXISTING EQUIPMENT:
All backflow prevention devices existing, which do not meet the requirements
hereof shall nonetheless be required to comply with the requirements of this
chapter. Backflow prevention devices that are deemed by the director to be
nonetheless adequate for the purposes intended may be allowed, in which event
compliance with any particular provision hereof may be waived in writing by the
city. Such previously existing devices shall be subject to the periodic
inspection and testing requirements of this chapter. Whenever an existing
backflow prevention device is moved to another location, or requires more than
minimum maintenance, or where it is determined to constitute a hazard to
health, the unit shall be replaced by an approved backflow prevention device
meeting the requirements of this chapter. (Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.080: REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE OF EQUIPMENT:
The maintenance, including necessary repairs, of all backflow prevention
devices required by this chapter shall be the responsibility of the owner of
property where such a device is installed. (Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.090: ACCESS FOR INSPECTION:
All water systems connecting to the city public drinking water system shall be
open for inspection at all reasonable times by authorized representatives of
the city in order to determine whether cross connections or other structural or
sanitary hazards including violations of this chapter exist. In order to make
such determination, the inspection shall include access to above ceiling areas,
pits, paneled interior areas, or their locations where cross connections might
exist. Each owner and/or any occupant shall be responsible to provide a route
of access across the property for inspection purposes that is free from litter,
overgrowth, the threat of a vicious animal, or other hindrance that may be
detrimental to the safety of the inspector or obstructive to ease of access.
(Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.100: CERTIFIED BACKFLOW TECHNICIAN:
All tests of backflow prevention devices shall be conducted by a certified
backflow technician, certified in accordance with rules and regulations of the
Idaho department of environmental quality, who will be responsible for the
competence and accuracy of all tests and reports. Such technician shall be
responsible to:
A.   Assure that acceptable testing equipment and procedures are used for the
testing, repairing or overhauling of backflow prevention devices.
B.   Make reports of such testing and/or repair within required times to the
owner and the director on a form approved for such use by the city.
C.   Include in all reports, a list of any materials or replacement parts used.
D.   Assure that replacement parts are equal in quality to original parts and
that any testing, repair or replacement does not change the design or
operational characteristics of the assembly.
E.   Maintain their license in current condition and all testing equipment in
proper operating condition.
F.   Be equipped with, and competent to use, all necessary tools, gauges, and
other equipment necessary to properly test and maintain backflow prevention
devices.
G.   Tag each double check valve, pressure vacuum breaker, reduced pressure
backflow assembly or other backflow prevention device showing the serial
number, date tested, and by whom, together with the technician's license
number.
H.   Inspect high hazard air gap assemblies.
I.   Comply with all OSHA standards on confined spaces, including procedures
for entering such spaces and required safety equipment. (Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.110: NOTIFICATION OF PUBLIC:
The city shall use reasonable means to notify its customers of the hazards of
cross connections and the need for annual inspection of backflow prevention
devices. (Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.120: RECORDS:
The city shall keep records of known cross connections and the condition of
backflow prevention devices, including those records required by state and
federal agencies. (Ord. 1025, 2007)
13.29.130: VIOLATIONS:
Service of water to a consumer on property found to be in violation of this
chapter shall be discontinued by the city after written notice of the violation
to both the owner and/or consumer, in accordance with other applicable
provisions of this code. A violation exists if:
A.   Backflow prevention devices required by this chapter for control of cross
connections are not installed, tested, or maintained, as required herein.
B.   It is found that a backflow prevention device has been removed or
bypassed.
C.   An unprotected cross connection exists on the premises of the owner.
D.   The periodic system inspection required herein has not been conducted.
E.   A false report or false information is provided to the city by or on
behalf of the owner or consumer, with regard to a cross connection or backflow
prevention device.
Where written notification of a deficiency is provided by the city, and the
owner fails to take the required corrective action within ten (10) days after
the date of mailing such notice, the city shall immediately commence
proceedings to discontinue water service unless the city, at the request of the
owner, authorizes a longer time for completion. Except that owners of existing
backflow devices that were installed prior to March 1, 2008, will have sixty
(60) days in the first year to correct deficiencies. Water service will not be
restored until the provisions of this chapter are complied with. (Ord. 1025,
2007)
CHAPTER 13.30
WATER SYSTEM CONNECTIONS
SECTION:
13.30.010: Connection Charges
13.30.020: Meter And Equipment Cost
13.30.030: Optional Installation Requirements
13.30.040: Exemption From Street Cut Fee
13.30.010: CONNECTION CHARGES:
A connection fee to each new customer service shall be paid by every new
customer connecting to the water system as follows:
